MC: The power of a statistical test of hypotheses is:

column3: the smallest significance level at which the data will allow you to reject the null hypothesis.
the extent to which the test will reject both one-sided and two-sided hypotheses.

defined for a particular value of the parameter of interest under the alternative hypothesis and is the probability that a fixed level significance test will reject the null hypothesis when this particular alternative value of the parameter is true.

MC: Which of the following will increase the value of the power in a statistical test of hypotheses?

column3: Consider computing the power for a value of the alternative that is farther from the value of the parameter of interest under the null hypothesis.

MC: In multiple regression analysis, if the model provides good fit, this indicates that:

column3: the sum of squares for error will be small.
the value of the regression standard error will be small.
the squared multiple regression correlation value is will be close to 1 or −1.
all of the above choices are correct.
